entry.title: Music Synthesizer Game in Supercollider
entry.content: A music synthesizer game made by my partner and I with Supercollider in our Introduction to Computer Music Course. We made three different main melodies and 16 individual short sound pieces. Players can click on the buttons to add the sound pieces to the music timeline to simply produces their own songs.

entry.title: Ray tracing renderer
entry.content:
In this project, I implemented two ray tracing renderer including witted-style ray tracing and path tracing. This project is based on the open course GAMES101 assignments. Github Link

In witted-style ray tracing, I completed the Moller Trumbore Algorithm for ray-triangle intersection and the witted-style ray tracing algorithm. The following figure is the rendering result.

In the path tracing renderer, I implemented the BVH algorithm to accelerate the rendering. Path tracing applied the physical based material to achieve a more realistic effect. I implemented the path tracing algorithm with Monte Carlo Integration. The following figure is the path tracing rendering output picture.

entry.title: World Generation Adventure Game
entry.content: This project a simple adventure game. In this game, players can give a random number and the program will automatically generate a random map (every random seed will lead to different game maps). In these maps, there are doors, lights, rooms and corridors. Players can open or close the door, turn on or turn off the light. Players can win the game if they successfully close all the doors. The code is in the github repository Lucas-hao/World-Generation-Game. The following video is a simple demo of the project.

entry.title: My first English blog
entry.content:
This is my first English blog post. I would like to share with you my works and learning experiences in this website in the future.

I am excited about computer graphcis and game making. Besides, I am also a fan of Janpanese animes. You can know more about me in ABOUT ME. You can also find contact information there.

Here is some projects I have done in class or during my spare time PORTFOLIO.

Thank you for visiting my website!
